rules: Rule1: Whenever the agent obtains evidence illegally, it follows that the court does not admit evidence.
Rule2: Whenever the agent intends to test the suspect, the agent conducts a test on the suspect.

Rule3: Under the condition that the agent has a warrant, if it is not the case that conducting a test on the suspect implies that having a breathalyzer tool leads to the suspect being a person implying the agent does not possess alcohol, then the agent makes an arrest of the suspect.
Rule4: Either the agent has a warrant or the agent has probable cause.

Rule5: If the agent has probable cause, then, provided that it is not the case that conducting a test on the suspect implies that having a breathalyzer tool leads to the suspect being a person implying the agent does not possess alcohol, the agent makes an arrest of the suspect.
Rule6: If the agent follows procedure, then the court upholds the conviction.
Rule7: Whenever it is not the case that obtaining evidence illegally by the agent implies the court admits evidence, the court dismisses the case.

Rule8: If it is not the case that conducting a test on the suspect implies that having a breathalyzer tool leads to the suspect being a person implying the agent does not possess alcohol, then the agent does not make an arrest of the suspect.
Rule9: Provided that the agent does not follow procedure, the agent obtains evidence illegally.
Rule10: Whenever the court does not uphold the conviction, the agent possesses alcohol.
facts: Fact1: The suspect is a person.
Fact2: The agent has a breathalyzer tool.
Fact3: The agent intends to test the suspect.
Fact4: The court does not dismiss the case.
